input.query: n8n workflow automation nodes integrations API webhooks code expressions credentials setup configuration

content.text:
### Complete n8n Workflow JSON Configuration for Sales File Generation

Source: https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/blob/main/docs/courses/level-two/chapter-5/chapter-5.2.md

Full JSON configuration for an n8n workflow that processes sales data through multiple nodes including Gmail sender, manual trigger, HTTP request, and Airtable search. This workflow demonstrates integration between various services including credential setup, email attachments, and external API calls. The configuration includes node positioning, parameters, and authentication credentials for a complete workflow setup.

```json
{
  "meta": {
    "templateCredsSetupCompleted": true,
    "instanceId": "cb484ba7b742928a2048bf8829668bed5b5ad9787579adea888f05980292a4a7"
  },
  "nodes": [
    {
      "parameters": {
        "sendTo": "bart@n8n.io",
        "subject": "Your TPS Reports",
        "emailType": "text",
        "message": "Please find your TPS report attached.",
        "options": {
          "attachmentsUi": {
            "attachmentsBinary": [
              {}
            ]
          }
        }
      },
      "id": "d889eb42-8b34-4718-b961-38c8e7839ea6",
      "name": "Gmail",
      "type": "n8n-nodes-base.gmail",
      "typeVersion": 2.1,
      "position": [2100, 500],
      "credentials": {
        "gmailOAuth2": {
          "id": "HFesCcFcn1NW81yu",
          "name": "Gmail account 7"
        }
      }
    },
    {
      "parameters": {},
      "id": "c0236456-40be-4f8f-a730-e56cb62b7b5c",
      "name": "When clicking \"Execute workflow\"",
      "type": "n8n-nodes-base.manualTrigger",
      "typeVersion": 1,
      "position": [780, 600]
    },
    {
      "parameters": {
        "url": "https://internal.users.n8n.cloud/webhook/level2-erp",
        "authentication": "genericCredentialType",
        "genericAuthType": "httpHeaderAuth",
        "sendHeaders": true,
        "headerParameters": {
          "parameters": [
            {
              "name": "unique_id",
              "value": "recFIcD6UlSyxaVMQ"
            }
          ]
        },
        "options": {}
      },
      "id": "cc106fa0-6630-4c84-aea4-a4c7a3c149e9",
      "name": "HTTP Request",
      "type": "n8n-nodes-base.httpRequest",
      "typeVersion": 4.1,
      "position": [1000, 500],
      "credentials": {
        "httpHeaderAuth": {
          "id": "qeHdJdqqqaTC69cm",
          "name": "Course L2 Credentials"
        }
      }
    },
    {
      "parameters": {
        "operation": "search",
        "base": {
          "__rl": true,
          "value": "apprtKkVasbQDbFa1",
          "mode": "list",
          "cachedResultName": "All your base",
          "cachedResultUrl": "https://airtable.com/apprtKkVasbQDbFa1"
        },
        "table": {
          "__rl": true,
          "value": "tblInZ7jeNdlUOvxZ",
          "mode": "list",
          "cachedResultName": "Course L2, Workflow 1",
          "cachedResultUrl": "https://airtable.com/apprtKkVasbQDbFa1/tblInZ7jeNdlUOvxZ"
        },
        "options": {}
      },
      "id": "e5ae1927-b531-401c-9cb2-ecf1f2836ba6"
    }
  ]
}
```

--------------------------------

### Workflows API

Source: https://context7.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/llms.txt

Manage workflows programmatically including creating, updating, activating, and deleting workflows. Workflows contain nodes and connections that define automation logic.

```APIDOC
## POST /api/v1/workflows

### Description
Creates a new workflow in n8n. Define the workflow's name, nodes, connections, and settings in the request body.

### Method
POST

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- No path parameters.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- **name** (string) - Required - The name of the new workflow.
- **nodes** (array) - Required - An array of node objects defining the workflow's logic.
- **connections** (object) - Required - An object defining the connections between nodes.
- **settings** (object) - Optional - Additional settings for the workflow.

### Request Example
```json
{
    "name": "My API Workflow",
    "nodes": [
      {
        "parameters": {},
        "name": "Start",
        "type": "n8n-nodes-base.start",
        "typeVersion": 1,
        "position": [250, 300]
      }
    ],
    "connections": {},
    "settings": {}
}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (201 Created)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the newly created workflow.
- **name** (string) - The name of the created workflow.
- **active** (boolean) - The active status of the workflow.
- **createdAt** (string) - Timestamp of workflow creation.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1234",
  "name": "My API Workflow",
  "active": false,
  "createdAt": "2023-01-01T12:00:00Z"
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## GET /api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Description
Retrieves the details of a specific workflow by its ID.

### Method
GET

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to retrieve.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the workflow.
- **name** (string) - The name of the workflow.
- **nodes** (array) - An array of node objects defining the workflow's logic.
- **connections** (object) - An object defining the connections between nodes.
- **active** (boolean) - The active status of the workflow.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1000",
  "name": "My API Workflow",
  "nodes": [
    {
      "parameters": {},
      "name": "Start",
      "type": "n8n-nodes-base.start",
      "typeVersion": 1,
      "position": [250, 300]
    }
  ],
  "connections": {},
  "active": false
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## PUT /api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Description
Updates an existing workflow identified by its ID. The request body should contain the fields to be updated.

### Method
PUT

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to update.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- **name** (string) - Optional - The new name for the workflow.
- **nodes** (array) - Optional - The updated array of node objects.
- **connections** (object) - Optional - The updated object defining node connections.
- **settings** (object) - Optional - Updated settings for the workflow.

### Request Example
```json
{
    "name": "Updated Workflow Name",
    "nodes": [
      {
        "parameters": {},
        "name": "Start",
        "type": "n8n-nodes-base.start",
        "typeVersion": 1,
        "position": [250, 300]
      },
      {
        "parameters": {},
        "name": "NewNode",
        "type": "n8n-nodes-base.noOp",
        "typeVersion": 1,
        "position": [450, 300]
      }
    ],
    "connections": {
      "Start": [
        {
          "node": "NewNode",
          "type": "main",
          "index": 0
        }
      ]
    }
}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the updated workflow.
- **name** (string) - The new name of the workflow.
- **updatedAt** (string) - Timestamp of workflow update.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1000",
  "name": "Updated Workflow Name",
  "updatedAt": "2023-01-01T13:00:00Z"
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## POST /api/v1/workflows/{id}/activate

### Description
Activates (publishes) a specific workflow, making it ready to be triggered.

### Method
POST

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}/activate

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to activate.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the activated workflow.
- **active** (boolean) - Will be `true` indicating the workflow is now active.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1000",
  "active": true
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## POST /api/v1/workflows/{id}/deactivate

### Description
Deactivates a specific workflow, preventing it from being triggered.

### Method
POST

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}/deactivate

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to deactivate.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the deactivated workflow.
- **active** (boolean) - Will be `false` indicating the workflow is now inactive.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1000",
  "active": false
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## DELETE /api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Description
Deletes a specific workflow permanently from n8n.

### Method
DELETE

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to delete.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (204 No Content)
- No content is returned for a successful deletion.

#### Response Example
```json
{}
```
```

```APIDOC
## GET /api/v1/workflows

### Description
Retrieves a list of all workflows, with optional filtering by active status, tags, and result limit.

### Method
GET

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- No path parameters.

#### Query Parameters
- **active** (boolean) - Optional - Filter workflows by their active status (e.g., `true` for active workflows).
- **tags** (string) - Optional - Filter workflows by a comma-separated list of tags (e.g., `production,testing`).
- **limit** (integer) - Optional - Limit the number of workflows returned in the response.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **data** (array) - An array of workflow objects, each containing details like `id`, `name`, `active` status, etc.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "1000",
      "name": "Production Workflow",
      "active": true,
      "tags": ["production"]
    },
    {
      "id": "1001",
      "name": "Development Workflow",
      "active": false,
      "tags": ["development"]
    }
  ]
}
```
```

--------------------------------

### Create, Update, and Manage Workflows via REST API

Source: https://context7.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/llms.txt

Programmatically manage workflows including creating new workflows, retrieving specific workflows, updating workflow definitions, activating/deactivating workflows, deleting workflows, and listing workflows with filters. Workflows contain nodes and connections that define automation logic.

```bash
# Create a new workflow
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "name": "My API Workflow",
    "nodes": [
      {
        "parameters": {},
        "name": "Start",
        "type": "n8n-nodes-base.start",
        "typeVersion": 1,
        "position": [250, 300]
      }
    ],
    "connections": {},
    "settings": {}
  }'

# Get a specific workflow
curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'

# Update a workflow
curl -X 'PUT' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "name": "Updated Workflow Name",
    "nodes": [...],
    "connections": {...}
  }'

# Activate (publish) a workflow
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000/activate' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'

# Deactivate a workflow
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000/deactivate' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'

# Delete a workflow
curl -X 'DELETE' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'

# List all workflows with filters
curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows?active=true&tags=production&limit=50' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'
```

--------------------------------

### Creating n8n Credentials via REST API

Source: https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/blob/main/docs/embed/managing-workflows.md

This snippet demonstrates how to programmatically create new credentials in an embedded n8n deployment using its REST API. It includes the HTTP POST request to the `/rest/credentials` endpoint, the required JSON payload specifying credential details like type, name, access nodes, and API key, and the expected JSON response confirming successful creation with a unique credential ID. This method allows for automated credential management.

```http
POST https://<n8n-domain>/rest/credentials
```

```json
{
   "name":"MyAirtable",
   "type":"airtableApi",
   "nodesAccess":[
      {
         "nodeType":"n8n-nodes-base.airtable"
      }
   ],
   "data":{
      "apiKey":"q12we34r5t67yu"
   }
}
```

```json
{
   "data":{
      "name":"MyAirtable",
      "type":"airtableApi",
      "data":{
         "apiKey":"q12we34r5t67yu"
      },
      "nodesAccess":[
         {
            "nodeType":"n8n-nodes-base.airtable",
            "date":"2021-09-10T07:41:27.770Z"
         }
      ],
      "id":"29",
      "createdAt":"2021-09-10T07:41:27.777Z",
      "updatedAt":"2021-09-10T07:41:27.777Z"
   }
}
```

--------------------------------

### Webhook Trigger for Workflow Execution

Source: https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/blob/main/docs/embed/managing-workflows.md

Call a workflow via its webhook endpoint to execute it with provided credentials and parameters. The webhook must be configured as the trigger node in the workflow and should receive user credentials and workflow parameters in the request body.

```APIDOC
## POST /webhook/{webhook-path}

### Description
Execute a workflow by calling its webhook endpoint with user credentials and workflow parameters.

### Method
POST

### Endpoint
https://<n8n-domain>/webhook/{webhook-path}

### Request Body
- **credentials** (object) - Required - User credentials for the workflow
- **parameters** (object) - Optional - Additional workflow parameters as needed

### Request Example
```json
{
  "credentials": {
    "username": "user@example.com",
    "password": "encrypted_password",
    "apiKey": "user_api_key"
  },
  "parameters": {
    "param1": "value1",
    "param2": "value2"
  }
}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **success** (boolean) - Indicates successful workflow execution
- **data** (object) - Workflow execution results
- **executionId** (string) - Unique identifier for this execution

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "result": "Workflow executed successfully"
  },
  "executionId": "exec_12345"
}
```
```

### Workflows API

Source: https://context7.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/llms.txt

Manage workflows programmatically including creating, updating, activating, and deleting workflows. Workflows contain nodes and connections that define automation logic.

```APIDOC
## POST /api/v1/workflows

### Description
Creates a new workflow in n8n. Define the workflow's name, nodes, connections, and settings in the request body.

### Method
POST

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- No path parameters.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- **name** (string) - Required - The name of the new workflow.
- **nodes** (array) - Required - An array of node objects defining the workflow's logic.
- **connections** (object) - Required - An object defining the connections between nodes.
- **settings** (object) - Optional - Additional settings for the workflow.

### Request Example
```json
{
    "name": "My API Workflow",
    "nodes": [
      {
        "parameters": {},
        "name": "Start",
        "type": "n8n-nodes-base.start",
        "typeVersion": 1,
        "position": [250, 300]
      }
    ],
    "connections": {},
    "settings": {}
}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (201 Created)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the newly created workflow.
- **name** (string) - The name of the created workflow.
- **active** (boolean) - The active status of the workflow.
- **createdAt** (string) - Timestamp of workflow creation.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1234",
  "name": "My API Workflow",
  "active": false,
  "createdAt": "2023-01-01T12:00:00Z"
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## GET /api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Description
Retrieves the details of a specific workflow by its ID.

### Method
GET

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to retrieve.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the workflow.
- **name** (string) - The name of the workflow.
- **nodes** (array) - An array of node objects defining the workflow's logic.
- **connections** (object) - An object defining the connections between nodes.
- **active** (boolean) - The active status of the workflow.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1000",
  "name": "My API Workflow",
  "nodes": [
    {
      "parameters": {},
      "name": "Start",
      "type": "n8n-nodes-base.start",
      "typeVersion": 1,
      "position": [250, 300]
    }
  ],
  "connections": {},
  "active": false
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## PUT /api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Description
Updates an existing workflow identified by its ID. The request body should contain the fields to be updated.

### Method
PUT

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to update.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- **name** (string) - Optional - The new name for the workflow.
- **nodes** (array) - Optional - The updated array of node objects.
- **connections** (object) - Optional - The updated object defining node connections.
- **settings** (object) - Optional - Updated settings for the workflow.

### Request Example
```json
{
    "name": "Updated Workflow Name",
    "nodes": [
      {
        "parameters": {},
        "name": "Start",
        "type": "n8n-nodes-base.start",
        "typeVersion": 1,
        "position": [250, 300]
      },
      {
        "parameters": {},
        "name": "NewNode",
        "type": "n8n-nodes-base.noOp",
        "typeVersion": 1,
        "position": [450, 300]
      }
    ],
    "connections": {
      "Start": [
        {
          "node": "NewNode",
          "type": "main",
          "index": 0
        }
      ]
    }
}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the updated workflow.
- **name** (string) - The new name of the workflow.
- **updatedAt** (string) - Timestamp of workflow update.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1000",
  "name": "Updated Workflow Name",
  "updatedAt": "2023-01-01T13:00:00Z"
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## POST /api/v1/workflows/{id}/activate

### Description
Activates (publishes) a specific workflow, making it ready to be triggered.

### Method
POST

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}/activate

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to activate.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the activated workflow.
- **active** (boolean) - Will be `true` indicating the workflow is now active.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1000",
  "active": true
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## POST /api/v1/workflows/{id}/deactivate

### Description
Deactivates a specific workflow, preventing it from being triggered.

### Method
POST

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}/deactivate

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to deactivate.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **id** (string) - The unique identifier of the deactivated workflow.
- **active** (boolean) - Will be `false` indicating the workflow is now inactive.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "id": "1000",
  "active": false
}
```
```

```APIDOC
## DELETE /api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Description
Deletes a specific workflow permanently from n8n.

### Method
DELETE

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows/{id}

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- **id** (integer) - Required - The unique identifier of the workflow to delete.

#### Query Parameters
- No query parameters.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (204 No Content)
- No content is returned for a successful deletion.

#### Response Example
```json
{}
```
```

```APIDOC
## GET /api/v1/workflows

### Description
Retrieves a list of all workflows, with optional filtering by active status, tags, and result limit.

### Method
GET

### Endpoint
/api/v1/workflows

### Parameters
#### Path Parameters
- No path parameters.

#### Query Parameters
- **active** (boolean) - Optional - Filter workflows by their active status (e.g., `true` for active workflows).
- **tags** (string) - Optional - Filter workflows by a comma-separated list of tags (e.g., `production,testing`).
- **limit** (integer) - Optional - Limit the number of workflows returned in the response.

#### Request Body
- No request body.

### Request Example
```json
{}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **data** (array) - An array of workflow objects, each containing details like `id`, `name`, `active` status, etc.

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "1000",
      "name": "Production Workflow",
      "active": true,
      "tags": ["production"]
    },
    {
      "id": "1001",
      "name": "Development Workflow",
      "active": false,
      "tags": ["development"]
    }
  ]
}
```
```

--------------------------------

### Create, Update, and Manage Workflows via REST API

Source: https://context7.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/llms.txt

Programmatically manage workflows including creating new workflows, retrieving specific workflows, updating workflow definitions, activating/deactivating workflows, deleting workflows, and listing workflows with filters. Workflows contain nodes and connections that define automation logic.

```bash
# Create a new workflow
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "name": "My API Workflow",
    "nodes": [
      {
        "parameters": {},
        "name": "Start",
        "type": "n8n-nodes-base.start",
        "typeVersion": 1,
        "position": [250, 300]
      }
    ],
    "connections": {},
    "settings": {}
  }'

# Get a specific workflow
curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'

# Update a workflow
curl -X 'PUT' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "name": "Updated Workflow Name",
    "nodes": [...],
    "connections": {...}
  }'

# Activate (publish) a workflow
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000/activate' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'

# Deactivate a workflow
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000/deactivate' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'

# Delete a workflow
curl -X 'DELETE' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows/1000' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'

# List all workflows with filters
curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1/workflows?active=true&tags=production&limit=50' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-N8N-API-KEY: your-api-key'
```

--------------------------------

### Creating n8n Credentials via REST API

Source: https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/blob/main/docs/embed/managing-workflows.md

This snippet demonstrates how to programmatically create new credentials in an embedded n8n deployment using its REST API. It includes the HTTP POST request to the `/rest/credentials` endpoint, the required JSON payload specifying credential details like type, name, access nodes, and API key, and the expected JSON response confirming successful creation with a unique credential ID. This method allows for automated credential management.

```http
POST https://<n8n-domain>/rest/credentials
```

```json
{
   "name":"MyAirtable",
   "type":"airtableApi",
   "nodesAccess":[
      {
         "nodeType":"n8n-nodes-base.airtable"
      }
   ],
   "data":{
      "apiKey":"q12we34r5t67yu"
   }
}
```

```json
{
   "data":{
      "name":"MyAirtable",
      "type":"airtableApi",
      "data":{
         "apiKey":"q12we34r5t67yu"
      },
      "nodesAccess":[
         {
            "nodeType":"n8n-nodes-base.airtable",
            "date":"2021-09-10T07:41:27.770Z"
         }
      ],
      "id":"29",
      "createdAt":"2021-09-10T07:41:27.777Z",
      "updatedAt":"2021-09-10T07:41:27.777Z"
   }
}
```

--------------------------------

### Webhook Trigger for Workflow Execution

Source: https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n-docs/blob/main/docs/embed/managing-workflows.md

Call a workflow via its webhook endpoint to execute it with provided credentials and parameters. The webhook must be configured as the trigger node in the workflow and should receive user credentials and workflow parameters in the request body.

```APIDOC
## POST /webhook/{webhook-path}

### Description
Execute a workflow by calling its webhook endpoint with user credentials and workflow parameters.

### Method
POST

### Endpoint
https://<n8n-domain>/webhook/{webhook-path}

### Request Body
- **credentials** (object) - Required - User credentials for the workflow
- **parameters** (object) - Optional - Additional workflow parameters as needed

### Request Example
```json
{
  "credentials": {
    "username": "user@example.com",
    "password": "encrypted_password",
    "apiKey": "user_api_key"
  },
  "parameters": {
    "param1": "value1",
    "param2": "value2"
  }
}
```

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **success** (boolean) - Indicates successful workflow execution
- **data** (object) - Workflow execution results
- **executionId** (string) - Unique identifier for this execution

#### Response Example
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "result": "Workflow executed successfully"
  },
  "executionId": "exec_12345"
}
```
```

# n8n API Reference (Context7 - 2026-02-02)

## Workflows API
Base: `https://<domain>/api/v1` | Auth: `X-N8N-API-KEY: <key>`

| Method | Endpoint | Purpose |
|--------|----------|---------|
| POST | /workflows | Create workflow |
| GET | /workflows/{id} | Get workflow |
| PUT | /workflows/{id} | Update workflow |
| POST | /workflows/{id}/activate | Activate |
| POST | /workflows/{id}/deactivate | Deactivate |
| DELETE | /workflows/{id} | Delete |
| GET | /workflows?active=true&limit=50 | List |

## Credentials: `POST /rest/credentials`
```json
{"name":"MyAPI","type":"airtableApi","nodesAccess":[{"nodeType":"n8n-nodes-base.airtable"}],"data":{"apiKey":"xxx"}}
```

## Webhook: `POST /webhook/{path}`
```json
{"credentials":{"apiKey":"xxx"},"parameters":{"param1":"value1"}}
```

## Code Node JavaScript
```javascript
// All items
const items = $input.all();
return items.map(i => ({json:{...i.json,processed:true}}));

// Each item
return {json:{...$json,calc:$json.price*$json.qty}};

// Other nodes
$('Webhook').first().json; $('HTTP Request').all();

// Vars & env
$vars.API_URL; $env.SECRET; $execution.id; $workflow.name;

// Dates (Luxon)
DateTime.now().plus({days:30}).toFormat('yyyy-MM-dd');
```

## Expressions `{{ }}`
```
{{$json.field}} {{$json.price*1.1}} {{$json.status==='active'?'Yes':'No'}}
{{$('Node').item.json.data}} {{DateTime.now().toISO()}}
{{$jmespath($json.users,"[?age>`30`].name")}}
```

## Built-in Variables
| Var | Use |
|-----|-----|
| $input.item/.all()/.first()/.last() | Current node data |
| $json, $binary | Shorthand input |
| $('Node').item/.all()/.first() | Other node data |
| $workflow.id/.name/.active | Workflow meta |
| $execution.id/.mode | Execution meta |
| $env.VAR, $vars.name | Environment/workflow vars |
| $now, $today, DateTime | Date/time |
| $runIndex, $itemIndex | Loop position |

## Cron (Schedule Trigger)
`0 9 * * *` daily 9am | `*/15 * * * *` every 15min | `0 0 * * 0` weekly Sun
Test: crontab.guru

*Source: n8n-io/n8n-docs*
EOF
